verses.kjv: And the whole multitude of them arose, and led him unto Pilate.
verses.ct: Then the entire assembly rose and brought him before Pilate.

verses.kjv: And they began to accuse him, saying, We found this fellow perverting the nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ a King.
verses.ct: They started making accusations against him, saying, "We caught this man misleading our nation, telling people not to pay taxes to Caesar, and claiming to be the Christ, a king."

verses.kjv: And Pilate asked him, saying, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered him and said, Thou sayest it.
verses.ct: Pilate asked him, "Are you the King of the Jews?" Jesus replied, "You have said it yourself."

verses.kjv: Then said Pilate to the chief priests and to the people, I find no fault in this man.
verses.ct: Pilate told the chief priests and the crowd, "I don't find this man guilty of anything."

verses.kjv: And they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people, teaching throughout all Jewry, beginning from Galilee to this place.
verses.ct: But they pressed harder, saying, "He stirs up the people with his teaching all across Judea, starting from Galilee and now here."

verses.kjv: When Pilate heard of Galilee, he asked whether the man were a Galilaean.
verses.ct: When Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked if the man was a Galilean.

verses.kjv: And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod’s jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.
verses.ct: Once he learned that Jesus fell under Herod's authority, he sent him over to Herod, who happened to be in Jerusalem at the time.

verses.kjv: And when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceeding glad: for he was desirous to see him of a long season, because he had heard many things of him; and he hoped to have seen some miracle done by him.
verses.ct: Herod was thrilled when he saw Jesus, because he had wanted to meet him for a long time. He had heard a lot about him and was hoping to see him perform some miracle.

verses.kjv: Then he questioned with him in many words; but he answered him nothing.
verses.ct: Herod asked him question after question, but Jesus gave him no answer at all.

verses.kjv: And the chief priests and scribes stood and vehemently accused him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, the chief priests and the scribes stood there making intense accusations against him.

verses.kjv: And Herod with his men of war set him at nought, and mocked him, and arrayed him in a gorgeous robe, and sent him again to Pilate.
verses.ct: Herod and his soldiers treated him with contempt and ridiculed him. They dressed him in an elegant robe and sent him back to Pilate.

verses.kjv: And the same day Pilate and Herod were made friends together: for before they were at enmity between themselves.
verses.ct: That very day, Pilate and Herod became friends — before this, they had been hostile toward each other.

verses.kjv: And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
verses.ct: Pilate called together the chief priests, the leaders, and the people.

verses.kjv: Said unto them, Ye have brought this man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having examined him before you, have found no fault in this man touching those things whereof ye accuse him:
verses.ct: He said to them, "You brought this man to me, claiming he was leading the people astray. But look — I have questioned him right in front of you and found him not guilty of any of the charges you're bringing against him.

verses.kjv: No, nor yet Herod: for I sent you to him; and, lo, nothing worthy of death is done unto him.
verses.ct: Neither has Herod, since he sent him back to us. Clearly, he has done nothing that deserves a death sentence.

verses.kjv: I will therefore chastise him, and release him.
verses.ct: So I will have him flogged and then let him go."

verses.kjv: (For of necessity he must release one unto them at the feast.)
verses.ct: (It was customary for him to release one prisoner to them during the festival.)

verses.kjv: And they cried out all at once, saying, Away with this man, and release unto us Barabbas:
verses.ct: But the whole crowd shouted together, "Get rid of this man! Release Barabbas to us!"

verses.kjv: (Who for a certain sedition made in the city, and for murder, was cast into prison.)
verses.ct: (Barabbas had been thrown in prison for starting a revolt in the city and for murder.)

verses.kjv: Pilate therefore, willing to release Jesus, spake again to them.
verses.ct: Pilate, wanting to set Jesus free, spoke to them again.

verses.kjv: But they cried, saying, Crucify him, crucify him.
verses.ct: But they kept shouting, "Crucify him! Crucify him!"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them the third time, Why, what evil hath he done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will therefore chastise him, and let him go.
verses.ct: A 3rd time he addressed them: "Why? What crime has he committed? I've found no reason to sentence him to death. I'll have him flogged and release him."

verses.kjv: And they were instant with loud voices, requiring that he might be crucified. And the voices of them and of the chief priests prevailed.
verses.ct: But they kept demanding with loud shouts that he be crucified, and their voices won out.

verses.kjv: And Pilate gave sentence that it should be as they required.
verses.ct: So Pilate ruled that their demand would be granted.

verses.kjv: And he released unto them him that for sedition and murder was cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he delivered Jesus to their will.
verses.ct: He released the man who had been imprisoned for revolt and murder — the one they wanted — and handed Jesus over to their wishes.

verses.kjv: And as they led him away, they laid hold upon one Simon, a Cyrenian, coming out of the country, and on him they laid the cross, that he might bear it after Jesus.
verses.ct: As they led him away, they grabbed a man named Simon from Cyrene, who was coming in from the countryside, and placed the cross on him to carry behind Jesus.

verses.kjv: And there followed him a great company of people, and of women, which also bewailed and lamented him.
verses.ct: A large crowd followed him, including women who were weeping and mourning for him.

verses.kjv: But Jesus turning unto them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.
verses.ct: Jesus turned to them and said, "Women of Jerusalem, don't cry for me. Cry for yourselves and for your children.

verses.kjv: For, behold, the days are coming, in the which they shall say, Blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never bare, and the paps which never gave suck.
verses.ct: Because the time is coming when people will say, 'How fortunate are the women who never had children, who never gave birth, who never nursed a baby.'

verses.kjv: Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall on us; and to the hills, Cover us.
verses.ct: At that point, people will beg the mountains, 'Collapse on top of us!' and plead with the hills, 'Bury us!'

verses.kjv: For if they do these things in a green tree, what shall be done in the dry?
verses.ct: Because if they do these things when the wood is green, what will happen when it's dry?"

verses.kjv: And there were also two other, malefactors, led with him to be put to death.
verses.ct: 2 other men, both criminals, were also led out with him to be executed.

verses.kjv: And when they were come to the place, which is called Calvary, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, and the other on the left.
verses.ct: When they arrived at the place called The Skull, they crucified him there along with the criminals — one on his right and one on his left.

verses.kjv: Then said Jesus, Father, forgive them; for they know not what they do. And they parted his raiment, and cast lots.
verses.ct: Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, because they don't understand what they're doing." They divided up his clothing by casting lots.

verses.kjv: And the people stood beholding. And the rulers also with them derided him, saying, He saved others; let him save himself, if he be Christ, the chosen of God.
verses.ct: The people stood watching. The leaders sneered at him, saying, "He rescued others — let him rescue himself if he really is the Christ, God's chosen one."

verses.kjv: And the soldiers also mocked him, coming to him, and offering him vinegar,
verses.ct: The soldiers also mocked him, coming up and offering him sour wine,

verses.kjv: And saying, If thou be the king of the Jews, save thyself.
verses.ct: saying, "If you're the King of the Jews, save yourself!"

verses.kjv: And a superscription also was written over him in letters of Greek, and Latin, and Hebrew, THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
verses.ct: An inscription was posted above him in Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.kjv: And one of the malefactors which were hanged railed on him, saying, If thou be Christ, save thyself and us.
verses.ct: One of the criminals hanging there hurled insults at him: "Aren't you the Christ? Save yourself and us!"

verses.kjv: But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost not thou fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation?
verses.ct: But the other criminal rebuked him, saying, "Don't you have any reverence for God? You're under the same death sentence!

verses.kjv: And we indeed justly; for we receive the due reward of our deeds: but this man hath done nothing amiss.
verses.ct: We deserve what we're getting — we're paying the price for what we did. But this man hasn't done anything wrong."

verses.kjv: And he said unto Jesus, Lord, remember me when thou comest into thy kingdom.
verses.ct: Then he said, "Jesus, Lord, remember me when you enter your kingdom."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Verily I say unto thee, To day shalt thou be with me in paradise.
verses.ct: Jesus told him, "Truly I tell you, today you will be with me in paradise."

verses.kjv: And it was about the sixth hour, and there was a darkness over all the earth until the ninth hour.
verses.ct: It was around noon, and darkness covered the whole land until 3 in the afternoon.

verses.kjv: And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.
verses.ct: The sun stopped shining, and the curtain of the temple was torn right down the middle.

verses.kjv: And when Jesus had cried with a loud voice, he said, Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit: and having said thus, he gave up the ghost.
verses.ct: Jesus called out in a loud voice, "Father, I place my spirit in your hands." After saying this, he took his last breath.

verses.kjv: Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.
verses.ct: When the Roman centurion witnessed what happened, he praised God, saying, "Without a doubt, this was a righteous man."

verses.kjv: And all the people that came together to that sight, beholding the things which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.
verses.ct: All the people who had gathered to watch, when they saw what took place, beat their chests in grief and walked away.

verses.kjv: And all his acquaintance, and the women that followed him from Galilee, stood afar off, beholding these things.
verses.ct: But everyone who knew him, including the women who had followed him from Galilee, stood at a distance watching all of this.

verses.kjv: And, behold, there was a man named Joseph, a counsellor; and he was a good man, and a just:
verses.ct: Now there was a man named Joseph, a member of the council, who was a good and righteous man.

verses.kjv: (The same had not consented to the counsel and deed of them;) he was of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews: who also himself waited for the kingdom of God.
verses.ct: (He had not agreed with the council's decision and actions.) He was from the Jewish town of Arimathaea, and he was waiting expectantly for the kingdom of God.

verses.kjv: This man went unto Pilate, and begged the body of Jesus.
verses.ct: This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.

verses.kjv: And he took it down, and wrapped it in linen, and laid it in a sepulchre that was hewn in stone, wherein never man before was laid.
verses.ct: He took it down, wrapped it in linen cloth, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock where no one had ever been buried before.

verses.kjv: And that day was the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.
verses.ct: It was Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was about to begin.

verses.kjv: And the women also, which came with him from Galilee, followed after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how his body was laid.
verses.ct: The women who had come with Jesus from Galilee followed along and saw the tomb and how his body was placed inside.

verses.kjv: And they returned, and prepared spices and ointments; and rested the sabbath day according to the commandment.
verses.ct: Then they went home and prepared spices and perfumed oils. On the Sabbath they rested, as the commandment required.
